other_tests.findings: Positive, indicating the presence of an autoantibody.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial test was positive without concurrent anemia; on admission, it was positive again with anemia present.

other_tests.findings: Panreactive with increased reactivity compared to previous tests.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased reactivity at the time of admission compared to two months prior when hemoglobin levels were normal.
Remained positive throughout the patientâ€™s course; viral load was undetectable by 24 weeks.

other_tests.procedure_name: Enzyme immunoassays for IgM and IgG antibodies to parvovirus B19
other_tests.findings: IgM level was 14.1 (reference range, <0.9); IgG level was 1.4 (reference range, <0.9).
other_tests.changes_over_time: IgM antibody level decreased rapidly during the first month; IgG antibody level increased and plateaued.
